etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Abraham Arden Brill (b. 1874). From mono- + sexuality, after monosexual

definitions: The condition of having reproductive organs of one sex only.
The condition of having members of one sex predominant.
The condition of having sexual relations in which one seeks to gratify only oneself.
The state or condition of being sexually attracted to members of one sex only. Opposed to bisexuality.
